title: Frankolala
author: Frankolala
content: This was Donald Trump speech at the Bitcoin 2024 Conference held in Nashville. Quote Former United States president and current Republican candidate Donald Trump announced his intent to make the United States the crypto capital of the world, if elected in November. After taking the stage an hour late, Trump addressed the crowd at the Bitcoin 2024 conference in Nashville, Tennessee, Trump said that he had great respect for the Bitcoin community, adding that “this is like the steel industry” when it was young. He told the crowd he had "great respect for the Bitcoin community", adding that “this is like the steel industry” when it was young. He also predicted that "one day" Bitcoin would overtake gold, gushing that "Bitcoin is not just a marvel of technology, as you know it's a miracle of cooperation and human achievement." Trump also stated that if in future bitcoin price skyrocket that let it be that America was the cause to make such happen. This shows Trump great interest in bitcoin and he is also standing for bitcoin community. What are your thoughts on this. You can read from the link for more details. https://cointelegraph.com/news/trump-implement-bitcoin-strategic-reserve-elected-president

comments.author: Odohu
comments.body: Attending the conference is a great move and a good one for the Bitcoin community. Even though he might have other intentions and agendas,  it becomes easy to hold him by his words which for now seem positive for Bitcoin. However, I have learnt not to swallow the words of politicians hook and sinkers,  rather I will take it with a pinch of salt as only time will reveal what the true intentions are. While we wait for the elections, it is wise to enjoy the gains that the market will make following these developments.

comments.author: FinneysTrueVision
comments.body: The speech will probably not be enough to move the needle for people who were on the fence about supporting Trump. It was the kind of sales pitch you would expect from a politician. The point was always to raise a lot of money from the crypto bros in town for the conference, and I’m sure he will accomplish this goal. The big news was that he would create a national strategic stockpile, pledging to maintain the current BTC acquired from criminal seizures. I’m sure Bitfinex will not be too pleased with that, since nearly half of the BTC held by the U.S. government was seized from the Bitfinex hackers.

comments.author: Darker45
comments.body: The Bitcoin Conference has grown interesting over time. The first one had around 70 participants. Today, speakers alone are already in the hundreds. The earliest conference was only a day. This time, it's 3 days. It's probably a lot cheaper, if not free, to attend the Bitcoin Conference when it started. Today, it's a hell lot more expensive. And although the earliest conference was already ironic in that it was bannered by centralized services, they were probably honest innovations, technological development done by believers of decentralization. Today, however, the conference is headlined by politicians who have no qualms lying through their teeth just to court voters. Even minor speakers aren't anymore led by technological innovators. They're led by congressmen, senators, wall street people, and the like. I'm not sure who influenced who, which infiltrated which, but if you say that this "shows Trump great interest in bitcoin" and that "he is also standing for bitcoin community", then I doubt it very much. If a man is convinced into Bitcoin by a politician as dirty as Trump, it may be that his belief in Bitcoin is built on sand.

comments.body: People seem to be upset about his comment that people can continue playing with Bitcoin. I don’t think he meant it like that though. Pretty much everything else he said was extremely bullish. It’s hard to believe to be honest. If the United States government starts trying to stack a million + BTC, things will be too crazy for me to imagine.

comments.author: Fiatless
comments.body: Quote from: Frankolala on July 27, 2024, 09:22:10 PMTrump also stated that if in future bitcoin price skyrocket that let it be that America was the cause to make such happen. No doubt about it, the US is currently the capital of cryptocurrencies. The country accommodates the majority of the sectors that make up the crypto industry. This is why economic and political policies in the US will always affect the market. Certainly, a sincere crypto-friendly president in the US will contribute to the growth of the currency globally.QuoteThis shows Trump great interest in bitcoin and he is also standing for bitcoin community. What are your thoughts on this. Words are cheap. Politicians can say or do anything to get power. Once they are enthroned, you can't hold them responsible for mere promises. I like the message of Edward Snowden, one of the speakers at the conference.QuoteTry to get what you need from them, but don’t give yourself to them, even if you have to vote for them.”Quotepoliticians who support Bitcoin and cryptocurrency solely as part of a party agenda for the purpose of courting voters were “not our tribe.”

Yeah The support of the American Senate is also necessary for everything to be put into practice... the part I liked most was Gary Genler's dismissal.

comments.author: retreat
comments.body: If you look at how Trump was able to achieve his current success, it cannot be separated from his method of diplomacy, politics and controversy. What he said at yesterday's conference were just the words of a politician, nothing more or less, and it was very different compared to his statements several years ago about Bitcoin. However, as long as he is still on the side of Bitcoin, I don't feel that it is completely wrong, but just don't have too much hope for what he says, because if he can change his words about Bitcoin in just a few moments, then he might be able to change his policy on Bitcoin later.

comments.author: legiteum
comments.body: If you actually lived in the USA and knew something about the politics here, you would not support Trump--even as a foreigner.Trump's political support comes mainly from two things:1. He promises to criminalize abortion in the USA, and attack women who have already had them by exposing their personal information.2. He promises to deport 5% of the US workforce immediately, leading the massive economic disruption.Both of these things will be very bad for Bitcoin, even if he doesn't move to takeover Bitcoin or replace it with his own currency, which is also very possible under Trump.But with so many in the Bitcoin community now begging for government intervention into the Bitcoin market--because they think it will temporarily prop up the price--I think Bitcoin's days as an independent entity are numbered. Inviting the government into Bitcoin's business is like inviting the Mafia into the business: they are nice at first, and then they will want their cut, and they they will take control. Here's how it will all go down:1. Trump will order the US to buy a huge chunk of Bitcoin, giving the US government effective control of the price of Bitcoin since the US has the power to buy and sell so much at once.2. With control of Bitcoin's price, Trump can then extort any imaginable concession from the community he wants.3. With control of Bitcoin secured, Bitcoin will then be controlled by US politics, and things like abortion drives US politics, not the net worths of people like Elon Musk.4. Voters who want to fight the new "War On Abortion" will want to control anything that allows payments to be made for illegal abortions, e.g. Bitcoin and other cryptos. 5. Hence, Bitcoin holders will be given a choice between accepting a defacto US takeover of the Bitcoin network or it being replaced by something that Trump himself profits from (or both).I keep saying this, and it's pretty obvious what is going to happen (maybe not exactly like that, but generally), but it would seem that the Bitcoin community is controlled by a few Bitcoin whales who care about absolutely nothing in the world except the price of Bitcoin in the next 72 hours.What Satoshi actually invented was the easiest market to manipulate by governments in the history of mankind.
